info.title: DeepHub®
info.description: This is the DeepHub® API, compliant to the omlox™ hub API 1.2.1. You can find out more about omlox™ at <https://www.omlox.com>.

tags.name: WebSocket
tags.description: The WebSocket API - Not part of the REST API.

get.summary: Get an array of all zones. If authorization is enabled only the corresponding zones are returned.
get.description: Returns an array of all zone objects.

200.description: An array of all zone summaries.

parameters.name: foreign_id
parameters.description: Find a zone by its foreign_id.

get.summary: Get an array of all zone ids. If authorization is enabled only the corresponding zone ids are returned.
get.description: This function returns an array of ids of all available zones.

200.description: An array of all zone ids.

parameters.name: foreign_id
parameters.description: Find a zone by its foreign_id.

post.description: Creates a new zone and returns the created object. The provided id will be replaced by a generated uuid.

Location.description: The path to the created object.

400.description: Zone not created. Check error message for details.

delete.description: This function deletes all zones known to the system.

400.description: Zones not deleted. Check error message for details.

get.summary: Get a zone.
get.description: Returns the zone object with the given id.

put.description: Updates the zone object with the given id.

400.description: Zone not updated. Check error message for details.

delete.description: Deletes the zone object with the given id.

400.description: Zone not deleted. Check error message for details.

put.summary: Transform a position within a zone to geographic coordinates.
put.description: Transforms the coordinates of a position in the zone with the given id to geographic coordinates.

parameters.name: geojson
parameters.description: Return the position as a GeoJSON object.

400.description: Transformation failed. Check error message for details.

get.summary: Create a fence object from a zone.
get.description: Creates a geofence object using the ground control points of the zone with the given id.

400.description: Failed to create a fence from zone. Check error message for details.

post.summary: Create a fence object with geographic coordinates via the zone's transformation configuration.
post.description: Consumes a fence with local coordinates related to the zone and creates a new fence object with geographic coordinates via the zone's transformation configuration.

400.description: Failed to create a fence transformed to the zone's coordinate system. Check error message for details.

get.summary: Get an array of all trackables. If authorization is enabled only the corresponding trackables are returned.
get.description: Returns an array of all trackable objects.

200.description: An array of all trackable objects.

get.summary: Gets an array of rules for locating trackables.
get.description: Returns an array of rules for locating trackables. The rule set applies to all trackables that don't have trackable specific rules.

404.description: Rules not found. Check error message for details.

put.description: Updates the locating rule set. The rule set applies to all trackables that don't have trackable specific rules.

200.description: The updated array of locating rules.

400.description: Bad Request. Check error message for details.

get.summary: Get an array of all trackable ids. If authorization is enabled only the corresponding trackable ids are returned.
get.description: This function returns an array of ids of all available trackables.

200.description: An array of all trackable ids.

post.description: Creates a new trackable with a randomly generated id.

parameters.name: force_location_update
parameters.description: If true, re-processes the most recent Location of the Location Providers assigned to this Trackable. No Location data stored in the hub will be changed. Events will be only generated in case of an actual change, for example if the new TrackableMotion causes the Trackable to enter a fence.

Location.description: The path to the created object.

400.description: Trackable not created. Check error message for details.

delete.description: This function deletes all trackables known to the system.

get.summary: Get a trackable.
get.description: Returns the trackable object with the given id.

delete.description: Deletes the trackable object with the given id.

put.description: Updates the trackable object with the given id.

parameters.name: force_location_update
parameters.description: If true, re-processes the most recent Location of the Location Providers assigned to this Trackable. If this Location is more recent than the existing TrackableMotion, the Motion will be replaced. No Location data stored in the hub will be changed. Events will be only generated in case of an actual change, for example if the replaced TrackableMotion causes the Trackable to enter a fence.

400.description: Trackable update failed. Check error message for details.

get.summary: Get an array of all trackable motion objects. If authorization is enabled only the corresponding trackable motions are returned.
get.description: Returns an array of all trackable motion objects.

parameters.name: crs
parameters.description: Project the geometry according to the specified EPSG coordinate reference system identifier.

parameters.name: zone_id
parameters.description: The zone id to be used to project coordinates.

parameters.name: geojson
parameters.description: Return the trackable motions as a GeoJSON feature collection.

200.description: An array of all trackable motion objects.

get.summary: Get a motion.
get.description: Returns the motion object for the trackable with the given id.

parameters.name: crs
parameters.description: Project the geometry according to the specified EPSG coordinate reference system identifier.

parameters.name: zone_id
parameters.description: The zone id to be used to project coordinates.

parameters.name: geojson
parameters.description: Return the trackable motion as a GeoJSON object.

404.description: Trackable motion not found, or motion for this trackable has not yet been generated.

get.summary: Get a location.
get.description: Returns the most recent location of the trackable with the given id, with consideration of all recent location updates from the trackable's location providers.

parameters.name: crs
parameters.description: Project the position according to the specified EPSG coordinate reference system identifier.

parameters.name: zone_id
parameters.description: The zone id to be used to project coordinates.

parameters.name: geojson
parameters.description: Return the location as a GeoJSON object.

400.description: Failed to create a location transformed to the given coordinate system. Check error message for details.

404.description: Trackable not found, or location providers have not been configured for this trackable.

get.summary: Get all locations.
get.description: Returns the last known location of the trackable with the given id for all of its location providers.

parameters.name: crs
parameters.description: Project the positions according to the specified EPSG coordinate reference system identifier.

parameters.name: zone_id
parameters.description: The zone id to be used to project coordinates.

parameters.name: geojson
parameters.description: Return the locations as a GeoJSON feature collection.

404.description: Trackable not found, or location providers have not been configured for this trackable.

get.summary: Get all fences the trackable is within.
get.description: Returns all fence objects the trackable with the given id is currently within.

parameters.name: spatial_query
parameters.description: If true, the query will be performed based strictly on spatial information, i.e. the last reported location of each provider. Otherwise, the query will take into account timeouts.

get.summary: Get an array of sensor objects.
get.description: Returns data from the sensors of all location providers associated with the trackable with the given id.

404.description: Trackable not found, or location providers have not been configured for this trackable.

get.summary: Get an array of all location providers. If authorization is enabled only the corresponding providers are returned.
get.description: Returns an array of all location provider objects.

200.description: An array of all location provider summaries.

get.summary: Get an array of all location provider ids. If authorization is enabled only the corresponding provider ids are returned.
get.description: This function returns an array of ids of all available providers.

200.description: An array of all location provider ids.

post.description: Creates a new location provider and returns the created object.

Location.description: The path to the created object.

400.description: Location provider not created. Check error message for details.

delete.description: This function deletes all location providers known to the system.

get.summary: Get a location provider.
get.description: Returns the location provider object with the given id.

put.description: Updates the location provider object with the given id.

400.description: Location provider not updated. Check error message for details.

delete.description: Deletes the location provider object with the given id.

put.description: This method updates the current location of the location provider with the given id.

get.summary: Get location.
get.description: Returns the last known location for a location provider.

parameters.name: crs
parameters.description: Project the position according to the specified EPSG coordinate reference system identifier.

parameters.name: geojson
parameters.description: Return the location as a GeoJSON object.

400.description: Failed to create a location transformed to the given coordinate system. Check error message for details.

delete.description: Deletes the location object of the provider with the given id.

get.summary: Get all fences the location provider is within.
get.description: Returns all fence objects the location provider with the given id is currently within.

parameters.name: spatial_query
parameters.description: If true, the query will be performed based strictly on spatial information, i.e. the last reported location of each provider. Otherwise, the query will take into account timeouts.

put.description: This method updates the sensor data of the location provider with the given id.

get.summary: Get sensor data.
get.description: Returns the sensor data for the location provider with the given id.

get.summary: Get all locations.
get.description: Returns the last known location for all location providers. If authorization is enabled only the corresponding locations are returned.

parameters.name: crs
parameters.description: Project the locations according to the specified crs (coordinate reference system) identifier. The crs MUST be either a valid EPSG identifier or ''local''. If the crs is ''local'' without a zone_id query parameter, the projection is done based on the location update's zone id ('source' property). If a zone_id query parameter is provided, the projection is done based on that zone projection.

parameters.name: zone_id
parameters.description: The zone id to be used to project coordinates.

parameters.name: geojson
parameters.description: Return the locations as a GeoJSON feature collection.

put.description: This path is used to update multiple locations in a bulk operation.

delete.description: This function deletes all location providers known to the system.

put.summary: Update location of location provider via a proximity event.
put.description: This method updates the current location of one location provider by an emitted proximity event. A location object is generated internally by using the position and floor information related to the omlox™ zone that generated the proximity event.

parameters.name: provider_id
parameters.description: The id of the provider for which to send a proximity event.

put.summary: Bulk update of locations based on proximity events.
put.description: This method updates locations related to proximity events in a bulk operation. Location objects are generated internally by using the position and floor information related to the omlox™ zone that generated the proximity events.

get.summary: Get an array of all fences. If authorization is enabled only the corresponding fences are returned.
get.description: Returns an array of all fence objects.

parameters.name: crs
parameters.description: Project the fence regions according to the specified crs (coordinate reference system) identifier. The crs MUST be either a valid EPSG identifier or ''local''. If the crs is ''local'' a zone_id query parameter MUST be provided to project the coordinates relative to the zone's coordinate system.

parameters.name: zone_id
parameters.description: The zone id to be used to project coordinates.

parameters.name: geojson
parameters.description: Return the locations as a GeoJSON feature collection.

200.description: An array of all fence objects. Returned fence objects use EPSG:4326 ("GPS") as the projection for the region coordinates, unless another projection is requested.

get.summary: Get an array of all fence ids. If authorization is enabled only the corresponding fence ids are returned.
get.description: This function returns an array of ids of all available fences.

200.description: An array of all fence ids.

post.description: Creates a new fence and returns the created object.

Location.description: The path to the created object.

delete.description: This function deletes all fences known to the system.

get.summary: Get a fence.
get.description: Returns the fence object with the given id.

parameters.name: crs
parameters.description: Project the fence regions according to the specified crs (coordinate reference system) identifier. The crs MUST be either a valid EPSG identifier or ''local''. If the crs is ''local'', a zone_id query parameter MUST also be provided to project the coordinates relative to the zone's coordinate system.

parameters.name: zone_id
parameters.description: The zone id to be used to project coordinates.

parameters.name: geojson
parameters.description: Return the locations as a GeoJSON feature collection.

put.description: Updates the fence object with the given id.

400.description: Fence not updated. Check error message for details.

delete.description: Deletes the fence object with the given id.

get.summary: Get all location providers within a fence.
get.description: Returns location providers which have a location that is currently considered as being inside the given fence, e.g., for which a region entry fence event was triggered.

parameters.name: spatial_query
parameters.description: If true, the query will be performed based strictly on spatial information, i.e. the last reported location of each provider. Otherwise, the query will take into account timeouts.

200.description: An array of all location provider ids.

get.summary: Get all trackables within a fence.
get.description: Returns trackables which have a location that is currently considered as being inside the given fence, e.g., for which a region entry fence event was triggered.

parameters.name: spatial_query
parameters.description: If true, the query will be performed based strictly on spatial information, i.e. the last reported location of each trackable. Otherwise, the query will take into account timeouts.

200.description: An array of all trackable ids.

404.description: Fence or expected trackables not found.

get.summary: Get location data of all location providers within a fence.
get.description: Returns locations of location providers which are currently considered as being inside the given fence, e.g., for which a region entry fence event was triggered.

parameters.name: crs
parameters.description: Project the position according to the specified EPSG coordinate reference system identifier.

parameters.name: zone_id
parameters.description: The zone id to be used to project coordinates.

parameters.name: geojson
parameters.description: Return the location as a GeoJSON object.

parameters.name: spatial_query
parameters.description: If true, the query will be performed based strictly on spatial information, i.e. the last reported location. Otherwise, the query will take into account timeouts.

200.description: An array of all locations inside the fence.

get.summary: Get motion data of all trackables within a fence.
get.description: Returns motions of trackables which are currently considered as being inside the given fence, e.g., for which a region entry fence event was triggered.

parameters.name: crs
parameters.description: Project the position according to the specified EPSG coordinate reference system identifier.

parameters.name: zone_id
parameters.description: The zone id to be used to project coordinates.

parameters.name: geojson
parameters.description: Return the location as a GeoJSON object.

parameters.name: spatial_query
parameters.description: If true, the query will be performed based strictly on spatial information, i.e. the last reported location. Otherwise, the query will take into account timeouts.

200.description: An array of all locations inside the fence.

get.summary: Consumption summary.
get.description: Get all consumption reports, each comprising the current fence and zone configuration and a detailed usage statistic.

get.summary: Current consumption.
get.description: Get the consumption report preview for the current billing period.

get.summary: Get the consumption report(s) for a specific year and month.
get.description: Returns the consumption report for a specific year and month.

200.description: Returns all consumption reports for given year and month.

get.summary: Get information about the license status.
get.description: Get textual information about the license status. This will, for example, include information on the remaining time in a trial period, or a warning if the license server could not be contacted.

get.summary: Start the trial period.
get.description: Start the trial period and get a lease with information  comprising the hub instance id and lease, trial and grace period end timestamps and an optional warning if the license server was not reachable.

400.description: The trial period expired, the license is not valid or the license server was not reachable. Refer to the error message for a description of the actual problem that occurred.

get.summary: Get the lease information.
get.description: Get information about the lease comprising the hub instance id and lease and grace period end timestamps, an optional warning if the license server was not reachable and optional trial information if it's a trial version.

400.description: The trial period expired, the license is not valid or the license server was not reachable. Refer to the error message for a description of the actual problem that occurred.

404.description: Lease not available or trial period not started.

400.description: Lease not deleted.

post.summary: Endpoint for CISCO CMX location update notifications web hook.
post.description: Endpoint for CISCO CMX location data which should be processed by the Hub. This endpoint can be used inside the CISCO CMX configuration as a web hook, so that location updates are sent automatically to the hub without another middleware in between. Please refer to the CISCO CMX (10.6 or later) documentation regarding the expected data structure.

put.summary: Endpoint for CISCO CMX location update notifications web hook.
put.description: See documentation for POST to this endpoint.

400.description: Zone not created. Check error message for details.

post.summary: Endpoint for validating a single locating rule expression.
post.description: This endpoint can be used to validate the expression of a locating rule, as it would be used for trackables.

400.description: The expression contains errors, which are further explained in the returned error object.

get.summary: Check whether the service is running.
get.description: This endpoint can be used to check if the hub is running.

get.summary: Get health information about all sources.
get.description: This endpoint can be used to get a summary of the state of all sources.

200.description: Response with information about the sources.

get.summary: Get health information about the source with the given id.
get.description: This endpoint can be used to get information about the state of the source with the given id.

200.description: Response with information about the source with the given id.

get.summary: Get health information about the system.
get.description: This endpoint can be used to get information about the system such as the configuration, connections, uptime and more.

get.summary: Get health information about websocket connections.
get.description: This endpoint can be used to get information regarding the websocket connections and subscriptions.

200.description: Response regarding current websocket connections and subscriptions.

get.summary: Get health information about the zones.
get.description: This endpoint can be used to get a summary of the state of the zones.

200.description: Response with information about the zones.

get.summary: Get health information about the zone with the given id.
get.description: This endpoint can be used to get information about the state of the zone with the given id.

200.description: Response with information about the zone with the given id.

put.description: WebSocket publish/subscribe channel. Note: This API is only a placeholder for the omlox™ WebSocket connection. This URL does not exist for the REST interface.

Collision.description: Collision information for a colliding object.

id.description: A unique identifier, e.g. representing the trackable id.

object_type.description: The object type associated to the id.

position.description: The original position of e.g. the location provider.

geometry.description: The trackable's polygon, e.g. generated by its radius.

floor.description: A logical and non-localized representation for a building floor. Floor 0 represents the floor designated as 'ground'. Negative numbers designate floors below the ground floor, and positive numbers indicate floors above the ground floor. When implemented, the floor value MUST match described logical numbering scheme, which can be different from any numbering used within a building. Values can be expressed as an integer value, or as a float as required for mezzanine floor levels. If a value for the floor level is not provided, 0 MUST be assumed.

id.description: A unique identifier for this event.

collision_type.description: The collision event type. Either "collision_start", "colliding", or "collision_end". Type "collision_start" MUST be set when two objects collide, "colliding" MUST be set when two objects are still colliding after a position update, and "collision_end" MUST be set when two previously colliding objects separate from each other.

start_time.description: The timestamp when the two objects first collided. The timestamp MUST be an ISO 8601 timestamp using UTC timezone and it SHOULD have millisecond precision.

end_time.description: The timestamp when the two objects were released from a collision with each other. The timestamp MUST be an ISO 8601 timestamp using UTC timezone and it SHOULD have millisecond precision.

collision_time.description: The timestamp when the continuing collision event was triggered, e.g. two objects started colliding and a collision_start event was sent and continue colliding after another position update was sent. The timestamp MUST be an ISO 8601 timestamp using UTC timezone and it SHOULD have millisecond precision.

collisions.description: The two objects colliding with each other. The first object in the array MUST be the object which triggered the event. For example, location for trackable A was updated and is now colliding with trackable B, thus trackable A triggered this particular event and must come first.

center_distance.description: The center-to-center distance between the two colliding objects in meters.

id.description: A unique identifier for this object.

timestamp_generated.description: The timestamp when the consumption report was generated. The timestamp MUST be an ISO 8601 timestamp using UTC timezone.

year.description: The year for which the report was generated.

month.description: The month for which the report was generated.

locationproviders_no.description: The current number of location providers.

trackables_no_active.description: The number of trackables which have been active this month.

locationproviders_no_active.description: The number of location providers which have been active this month.

type.description: A text representation of the error type. One of "bad request", "unauthorized", "conflict", "not found" or "server error".

message.description: A human readable error message which may give a hint to what went wrong.

region.description: A GeoJSON geometry defining the region of the geofence.

radius.description: If the region is a point, the radius defines a circular region around that point in meters. The radius value is ignored for polygonal regions.

extrusion.description: The extrusion to be applied to the geometry in meters. Must be a positive number. If not set, or set to null, it will default to MAX_EXTRUSION. If not set, or set to null, and a floor is not specified, the extrusion is infinite. If not set, or set to null, and a floor is specified, the extrusion is clamped to the specified floor. If set to 0, the geometry will have an extrusion of 0m and will be treated as a slice/plane. If a z-coordinate is provided by a Location Provider, it MUST match with the extrusion.

floor.description: The canonical representation of the floor level, where floor 0 is the ground floor.

foreign_id.description: The foreign_id represents a foreign unique identifier for the origin of a fence event, such as an UWB zone id or an iBeacon identifier. If a foreign_id is set, the foreign id MUST be resolved by the DeepHub.

name.description: A textual representation of the fence.

timeout.description: The timeout in milliseconds after which a location should expire and trigger a fence exit event (if no more location updates are sent). Must be a positive number or -1 in case of an infinite timeout. If not set, or set to null, it will default to infinite.

exit_tolerance.description: The distance tolerance to a fence in meters before an exit event is triggered. Useful for locations nearby or on the border of a fence to avoid fluctuating fence entry / exit events. For example, a location which was previously inside a fence will remain within the fence when its distance to the fence is less than or equal to the given tolerance. Must be a positive number. If not set, or null, the exit_tolerance will default to 0.

tolerance_timeout.description: The timeout in milliseconds after which a location outside of a fence, but still within exit_tolerance distance to that fence, should trigger a fence exit event. For example, assume an exit_tolerance of 1m: A location previously within the fence is now located 50cm outside of the fence and remains within the given exit_tolerance distance to that fence. An exit event is triggered after tolerance_timeout when the location remains outside of the fence. If not set, or null, the timeout will be equal to the fence timeout. If tolerance_timeout is greater than the fence timeout the tolerance_timeout will be reduced to the Fence timeout. The provided number must be positive or -1 in case of an infinite tolerance_timeout.

exit_delay.description: The delay in milliseconds in which an imminent exit event should wait for another location update. This is relevant for fast rate position updates with quick moving objects. For example, an RTLS provider may batch location updates into groups, resulting in distances being temporarily outdated and premature events between quick moving objects. The provided number must be positive or -1 in case of an infinite exit_delay. If not set, or null, exit_delay will default to 0.

crs.description: A projection identifier defining the projection of the fence region coordinates. The crs MUST be either a valid EPSG identifier (https://epsg.io) or 'local' if the fence region is provided as relative coordinates of a zone. If crs is not present, 'EPSG:4326' ("GPS") MUST be assumed as the default.

zone_id.description: The zone id related to the fence's region. This field MUST be present in case crs projection is set to 'local'.

elevation_ref.description: An elevation reference hint for the position's z component. If present, it MUST be either 'floor' or 'wgs84'. If set to 'floor' the z component MUST be assumed to be relative to the floor level. If set to 'wgs84' the z component MUST be treated as WGS84 ellipsoidal height. For the majority of applications an accurate geographic height may not be available. Therefore elevation_ref MUST be assumed 'floor' by default if this property is not present.

properties.description: Any additional application or vendor specific properties. An application implementing this  object is not required to interpret any of the custom properties, but it MUST preserve the properties if set.

id.description: A unique identifier for this event.

fence_id.description: The fence which generated this event.

provider_id.description: The id of the Location Provider which triggered this event. Note: provider_id must be null in case the event was triggered by a Trackable.

trackable_id.description: The id of the Trackable for which the event was generated. Note: trackable_id must be null in case the event was triggered by a Location Provider.

trackables.description: The ids of trackables the provider is assigned to.

foreign_id.description: An optional unique foreign identifier related to this event, e.g. an ibeacon identifier. The foreign_id SHOULD be set if available.

entry_time.description: The timestamp when the location was first registered inside the fence. The timestamp MUST be an ISO 8601 timestamp using UTC timezone and it SHOULD have millisecond precision.

exit_time.description: The timestamp when the exit event was triggered. The timestamp MUST be an ISO 8601 timestamp using UTC timezone and it SHOULD have millisecond precision.

properties.description: Application specific properties copied from the Fence object for which the event was triggered. An application is not required to interpret any of the custom properties, but it MUST preserve the properties if set.

uptime.description: The uptime of this DeepHub instance in seconds.

date.description: The current time of the DeepHub instance.

iso_24730_connections.description: The number of ISO-24730 connections configured for this DeepHub instance.

config.description: The configuration with which this DeepHub instance has been started.

number_of_clients.description: The number of clients that have an open websocket connection.

number_of_subscribers.description: The number of all websocket topic subscriptions.

number_of_subscribers_locations.description: The number of websocket topic subscriptions for locations in JSON and GeoJson format.

number_of_subscribers_trackable_motions.description: The number of websocket topic subscriptions for trackable motions in JSON and GeoJson format.

number_of_subscribers_fence_events.description: The number of websocket topic subscriptions for fence events in JSON and GeoJson format.

number_of_subscribers_collision_events.description: The number of websocket topic subscriptions for collision events.

last_location_update_sent.description: The timestamp when the last location update was published via websocket. The timestamp MUST be an ISO 8601 timestamp using UTC timezone and it SHOULD have millisecond precision.

last_trackable_motion_update_sent.description: The timestamp when the last trackable motion update was published via websocket. The timestamp MUST be an ISO 8601 timestamp using UTC timezone and it SHOULD have millisecond precision.

last_fence_event_sent.description: The timestamp when the last fence event was published via websocket. The timestamp MUST be an ISO 8601 timestamp using UTC timezone and it SHOULD have millisecond precision.

last_collision_event_sent.description: The timestamp when the last collision event was published via websocket. The timestamp MUST be an ISO 8601 timestamp using UTC timezone and it SHOULD have millisecond precision.

number_of_updates.description: The number of updates of this source.

last_update_received.description: The timestamp when the source received its last update. The timestamp MUST be an ISO 8601 timestamp using UTC timezone and it SHOULD have millisecond precision.

last_update_type.description: The type of connection by which the source was updated.

reconnects.description: The number of reconnects that took place if the source was of type ISO-24730.

connection_established.description: Whether an ISO-24730 connection was established.

uptime.description: The time in seconds for which the ISO-24730 connection persists.

hub_instance_id.description: The hub's instance UUID which requested the lease.

lease_end_timestamp.description: The lease timestamp when the client needs to verify it's license again.

grace_period_timestamp.description: The grace until the hub will stop service in case the lease is not renewed.

is_trial.description: Whether the hub runs in trial mode and should end operation after trial_end_timestamp.

trial_end_timestamp.description: The date when the trial ends.

lease_warning.description: Optional information about the lease status.

development_info.description: Optional information about the license type.

map_source.description: The map provider for the UI.

map_access_token.description: The access token for the map.

map_style.description: The style used for the map.

send_report.description: Whether the hub needs to send reports.

info.description: Information about the status of the license.

warning.description: Whether there is a warning for the current license status.
warning.example: This instance was unable to reach the Flowcate license server. Please ensure that you have a proper internet connection. Remaining days until shutdown: 21.

trial_info.description: Information about the trial status, if it is a trial.
trial_info.example: Trial version will expire on 2022-01-31. Remaining days on trial version: 132.

development_info.example: This is a development license. Do not use in a production environment.

LineString.description: GeoJSON LineString geometry. Important: A LineString object MUST be interpreted according to a coordinate reference system (crs). The ordering of components is x, y, z or longitude, latitude, elevation respectively as according to the GeoJSON specification.

expression.description: The conditions of the LocatingRule. Supported properties are: accuracy, provider_id, type, source, floor, speed, timestamp_diff.

priority.description: The priority of the LocatingRule. The higher the value the higher the priority of the rule.

source.description: Represents the unique identifier of the RTLS system (zone_id or foreign_id) which generated this location object, or the id of a self-localizing device (e.g. a UWB tag / provider_id in GPS mode).

provider_type.description: The location provider type which triggered this location update.

provider_id.description: The location provider's unique identifier, e.g. the mac address of a UWB location provider.

trackables.description: The ids of trackables the provider is assigned to.

timestamp_generated.description: The timestamp when the location was calculated. The timestamp MUST be an ISO 8601 timestamp using UTC timezone and it SHOULD have millisecond precision to allow for precise speed and course calculations.

timestamp_sent.description: The timestamp when the location was sent over the network. The timestamp MUST be an ISO 8601 timestamp using UTC timezone and it SHOULD have millisecond precision. Note: No delivery guarantee is made in case the data is lost in transit.

crs.description: A projection identifier defining the projection of the provided location coordinate. The crs MUST be either a valid EPSG identifier (https://epsg.io) or 'local' if the location is provided as a relative coordinate of the floor plan. For best interoperability and worldwide coverage, WGS84 (EPSG:4326) SHOULD be the preferred projection (as used also by GPS). If the crs field is not present, 'local' MUST be assumed as the default.

associated.description: Whether a client is currently associated to a network. This property SHOULD be set if available for WiFi based positioning.

accuracy.description: The horizontal accuracy of the location update in meters.

floor.description: A logical and non-localized representation for a building floor. Floor 0 represents the floor designated as 'ground'. Negative numbers indicate floors below the ground floor and positive numbers indicate floors above the ground floor. When implemented, the floor value MUST match described logical numbering scheme, which can be different from any numbering used within a building. Values can be expressed as an integer value, or as a float as required for mezzanine floor levels. If no value for the floor level is provided, 0 MUST be assumed.

true_heading.description: An accurate orientation reading from a 'true' heading direction. The 'true' magnetic as opposed to the normal magnetic heading. Applications SHOULD prefer the true heading if available. An invalid or currently unavailable heading MUST be indicated by a negative value.

magnetic_heading.description: The magnetic heading direction, which deviates from the true heading by a few degrees and differs slightly depending on the location on the globe.

heading_accuracy.description: The maximum deviation in degrees between the reported heading and the true heading.

elevation_ref.description: An elevation reference hint for the position's z component. If present it MUST be either 'floor' or 'wgs84'. If set to 'floor' the z component MUST be assumed to be relative to the floor level. If set to 'wgs84' the z component MUST be treated as WGS84 ellipsoidal height. For the majority of applications an accurate geographic height may not be available. Therefore elevation_ref MUST be assumed 'floor' by default if this property is not present.

speed.description: The current speed in meters per second. If the value is null or the property is not set, the current speed MAY be approximated by DeepHub based on the timestamp_generated value of a previous location update.

course.description: The current course ("compass direction"), which is the direction measured clockwise as an angle from true north on a compass (north is 0°, east is 90°, south is 180°, and west is 270°). If the value is null or the property is not set, the course will be approximated by DeepHub based on the previous location.

properties.description: Any additional application or vendor specific properties. An application implementing this  object is not required to interpret any of the custom properties, but it MUST preserve the properties if set.

id.description: Must be a valid id for the specific location provider type (e.g. a MAC address of a UWB tag)

type.description: Type of the location provider. A virtual location provider can be used for assigning a unique id to a location provider which does not have a unique identifier by itself. For example, an iOS app will not get the MAC address of the Wi-Fi interface for WiFi positioning. Instead, it will create a virtual location provider to identify the provider and the trackable (iOS device) for location updates.

name.description: An optional name for the location provider.

sensors.description: Sensor data related to a location provider. The actual structure of the sensor data is application defined.

fence_timeout.description: The timeout in milliseconds after which a location should expire and trigger a fence exit event (if no more location updates are sent). Must be a positive number or -1 in case of an infinite timeout. If not set, or set to null, it will default to the trackable or fence timeout setting.

exit_tolerance.description: The minimum distance in meters to release from an ongoing collision or fence event. Must be a positive number. If not set or null exit_tolerance will default to 0.

tolerance_timeout.description: The timeout in milliseconds after which a collision outside of an obstacle but still within exit_tolerance distance should release from a collision or fence event. Must be a positive number or -1 in case of an infinite timeout. If not set, or set to null, it will default to the fence or trackable timeout setting.

exit_delay.description: The delay in milliseconds in which an imminent exit event should wait for another location update. This is relevant for fast rate position updates with quick moving objects. For example, an RTLS provider may batch location updates into groups, resulting in distances being temporarily outdated and premature events between quickly moving objects. The provided number must be positive or -1 in case of an infinite exit_delay. If not set or null, exit_delay will default to 0.

properties.description: Any additional application or vendor specific properties. An application implementing this  object is not required to interpret any of the custom properties, but it MUST preserve the properties if set.

Point.description: A GeoJSON Point geometry. Describes a point (ie. a position) in 2 or 3 dimensions. Important: A Point object MUST be interpreted according to a coordinate reference system (crs), e.g. the crs field in the Location object. As an example, if a Position object with relative x,y,z data from an UWB system is given in the coordinate system of a local zone, a transformation would need to be applied to convert the position to a geographic coordinate. Alternatively, a Position may contain a geographic coordinate (longitude, latitude) from a GPS system (where no coordinate transformation is needed), or position data in a UTM zone projection (where transformation would be required). The ordering of components is x,y,z or longitude,latitude,elevation respectively as according to the GeoJSON specification.

Polygon.description: A GeoJSON Polygon geometry. Important: A Polygon object MUST be interpreted according to a coordinate reference system (crs). The ordering of components is x,y,z or longitude,latitude,elevation respectively as according to the GeoJSON specification.

source.description: Represents the unique identifier of the proximity system (ie. zone_id or foreign_id) that generated the proximity object. For example, this could be the RFID station id or iBeacon UUID.

provider_type.description: The location provider type that triggered the proximity update.

provider_id.description: The location provider unique identifier, e.g. the UID or TID of a RFID tag.

timestamp_generated.description: The timestamp when the location was calculated. The timestamp MUST be an ISO 8601 timestamp using UTC timezone and it SHOULD have millisecond precision to allow for precise speed and course calculations.

timestamp_sent.description: The timestamp when the location was sent over the network. The timestamp MUST be an ISO 8601 timestamp using UTC timezone and it SHOULD have millisecond precision. Note: No delivery guaranty is made in case the data is lost on transit.

accuracy.description: The estimated distance in meters to the center of the proximity event emitter (e.g. the distance to the iBeacon).

properties.description: Any additional application or vendor specific properties. An application implementing this object is not required to interpret any of the custom properties, but it MUST preserve the properties if set.

RuleSet.description: The RuleSet is an array consisting of rules.

source.description: Represents the unique identifier of the RTLS system that generated this location object, or the trackable id of a self-localizing device (e.g. a UWB tag in GPS mode or a smartphone).

id.description: Must be a unique identifier (e.g. a UUID). When creating a trackable, a unique id will be generated if one is not provided.

type.description: Either 'omlox' or 'virtual'. An omlox™ compatible trackable knows it's location providers (e.g. embedded UWB, BLE, RFID hardware), and self-assigns it's location providers. A virtual trackable can be used to assign location providers to a logical asset.

extrusion.description: The extrusion to be applied to the geometry in meters. Must be a positive number. If not set, or set to null, it will default to MAX_EXTRUSION. If not set, or set to null, and a floor is not specified, the extrusion is infinite. If not set, or set to null, and a floor is specified, the extrusion is clamped to the specified floor. If set to 0, the geometry will have an extrusion of 0m and will be treated as a slice/plane. If a z-coordinate is provided by a Location Provider, it MUST match with the extrusion.

location_providers.description: The location provider ids (e.g. MAC addresses) assigned to the trackable. A location provider can only be assigned to one trackable at a time. Note: An application may create virtual location providers and assign these to a trackable if desired. This allows applications to identify trackables for location providers which themselves do not have a unique identifier (e.g. certain GPS devices).

fence_timeout.description: The timeout in milliseconds after which a location should expire and trigger a fence exit event (if no more location updates are sent). Must be a positive number or -1 in case of an infinite timeout. If not set, or set to null, it will default to the fence timeout setting.

exit_tolerance.description: The minimum distance in meters for a trackable to release from an ongoing collision. For example, for a trackable that was previously colliding with another trackable by being inside a trackable's radius, the collision event will not be released from the collision until its distance to the trackable's geometry is at least the given exit_tolerance. Must be a positive number. If not set or null, exit_tolerance will default to 0.

tolerance_timeout.description: The timeout in milliseconds after which a collision outside of a trackable, but within exit_tolerance distance to another obstacle, should release from a collision. Must be a positive number or -1 in case of an infinite timeout. If not set, or set to null, it will default to the fence timeout setting.

exit_delay.description: The delay in milliseconds in which an imminent exit event should wait for another location update. This is relevant for fast rate position updates with quick moving objects. For example, an RTLS provider may batch location updates into groups, resulting in distances being temporarily outdated and premature events between quickly moving objects. The provided number must be positive or -1 in case of an infinite exit_delay. If not set or null, exit_delay will default to 0.

radius.description: A radius provided in meters, defining the approximate circumference of the trackable. If a radius value is set, all position updates from any of the Location Providers will generate a circular geometry for the trackable, where the position is the center and the circle will be generated with the given radius.

properties.description: Any additional application or vendor specific properties. An application implementing this object is not required to interpret any of the custom properties, but it MUST preserve the properties if set.

id.description: The trackable UUID for which this motion data was generated.

extrusion.description: The extrusion to be applied to the geometry in meters. Must be a positive number.

properties.description: A copy of application or vendor specific properties from the Trackable for which this TrackableMotion was generated. An application implementing this  object is not required to interpret any of the custom properties, but it MUST preserve the properties if set. Properties MUST be copied from the related Trackable to this TrackableMotion object.

id.description: A unique identifier for this object.

instance_id.description: A unique identifier for this DeepHub instance.

uptime.description: The time this DeepHub instance has been running.

range.description: The datetime range for which this statistic summary was generated.

locationupdates_processed.description: The number of location updates processed by the hub during the datetime range.

locationupdates_sent.description: The number of location updates sent to subscribers of the location_updates topic during the datetime range.

locationupdates_geojson_sent.description: The number of geojson location updates sent to subscribers of the location_updates:geojson topic during the datetime range.

fenceevents_entry_processed.description: The number of fence entry events processed by the hub during the datetime range.

fenceevents_entry_sent.description: The number of fence entry events sent to subscribers of the fence_events topic during the datetime range.

fenceevents_entry_geojson_sent.description: The number of geojson fence entry events sent to subscribers of the fence_events:geojson topic during the datetime range.

fenceevents_exit_processed.description: The number of fence exit events processed by the hub during the datetime range.

fenceevents_exit_sent.description: The number of fence exit events sent to subscribers of the fence_events topic during the datetime range.

fenceevents_exit_geojson_sent.description: The number of geojson fence exit events sent to subscribers of the fence_events:geojson topic during the datetime range.

proximityupdates_processed.description: The number of proximity updates processed by the hub during the datetime range.

trackablemotions_processed.description: The number of trackable motion events processed by the hub during the datetime range.

trackablemotions_sent.description: The number of trackable motions updates sent to subscribers of the trackable_motions topic during the datetime range.

trackablemotions_geojson_sent.description: The number of trackable motions updates sent to subscribers of the trackable_motions:geojson topic during the datetime range.

collisions_start_processed.description: The number of collision start events processed by the hub during the datetime range.

collisions_start_sent.description: The number of collision start events sent to subscribers of the collision_events topic during the datetime range.

collisions_colliding_processed.description: The number of ongoing collision events processed by the hub during the datetime range.

collisions_colliding_sent.description: The number of ongoing collision events sent to subscribers of the collision_events topic during the datetime range.

collisions_end_processed.description: The number of collision end events processed by the hub during the datetime range.

collisions_end_sent.description: The number of collision end events sent to subscribers of the collision_events topic during the datetime range.

event.description: Event type for the WebSocket message. Must be 'error' for error messages.

description.example: Subscription failed. There is no topic with name 'unknown_topic'.

code.description: A numeric code representing the error state.

event.description: Event type for the WebSocket message. Must be 'message'.

topic.description: The topic for which this message was generated. The payload field must be interpreted according to the topic name. For example, for 'location_updates', the payload must contain a valid Location object.

payload.description: Array containing valid omlox™ objects. There must be only one type of object contained within this array, and it must correspond to the topic. For example, the topic 'location_updates' must contain valid Location objects within the payload or an empty array.

event.description: Event type for the WebSocket message. Must be 'subscribed' to notify a subscriber about a successful subscription.

topic.description: The topic for which the subscription was created.

subscription_id.description: A numeric subscription id representing the actual subscription.

event.description: Event type for the WebSocket message. Must be 'subscribe' when subscribing to a topic.

params.description: Optional parameter as a flat key / value property. Available parameters depend on the topic to subscribe. For example, crs and geojson params as defined for the location and fence API.

id.description: A unique identifier for the zone (e.g. UUID).

foreign_id.description: A foreign identifier related to the zone (e.g. a RFID scanner or a Wi-Fi map hierarchy).

position.description: The zone's position in EPSG:4326 (GPS) coordinates. For a complete configuration the position MUST be present for proximity based zones (RFID, iBeacon), and is OPTIONAL for all other zone types. For proximity based based positioning systems like RFID or iBeacon, the position represents the coordinates where the positioning system is located (e.g. the RFID scanner). For all others, the position MAY be used as a hint for the location of the infrastructure.

radius.description: For proximity based systems. Describes the zone as a circular region with a given radius in meters around the position. The radius MUST be ignored for non-proximity based position providers.

ground_control_points.description: An array containing a mapping between geographic coordinates (longitude, latitude) in WGS84 and relative coordinates (x,y) provided by the positioning system of the zone. For a complete configuration this property MUST be present for non-proximity based positioning systems (UWB, Wi-Fi, etc). This property MUST NOT be present for proximity based positioning systems, as these refer to the fixed position.

incomplete_configuration.description: Set to true to use an incomplete zone, which has to be further configured later. By default a complete configuration is required.

measurement_timestamp.description: The timestamp identifying when the EPSG:4326 coordinates for the zone definition were recorded. Using this value for location data processing is OPTIONAL. This value MAY be used for advanced coordinate projection. For example, to reflect tectonic drift of WGS84 location data which is fixed at the North American plate.

floor.description: The canonical representation of the floor level, where floor 0 is the ground floor. If no floor is set or floor is null, the fence is applied to all floor levels.

need_transformation.description: Whether the positions provided by the zone need transformation from local coordinates into real world coordinates. Coordinates MUST be in WGS84 projection if no transformation is to be applied.

description.description: An optional description providing additional information for the zone.
description.example: Zone handles production part movements for production step 9.

address.description: An address describing the location of the zone.

properties.description: Any additional application or vendor specific properties. An application implementing this  object is not required to interpret any of the custom properties, but it MUST preserve the properties if set.
